test_dialogue.speaker: Narrator
test_dialogue.text: Welcome to Veer Shivaji: Pratapgad Campaign! This is a test of the dialogue system.

test_dialogue.speaker: Shivaji
test_dialogue.text: Har Har Mahadev! I am Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, ready to defend the Maratha realm!

test_dialogue.speaker: Narrator
test_dialogue.text: The dialogue system is working perfectly. Press E or Space to advance through conversations.

level01_opening.speaker: Narrator
level01_opening.text: In May 1659, the shadow of war fell across the Deccan plateau...

level01_opening.speaker: Narrator
level01_opening.text: In the grand court of Bijapur, Adil Shah sat upon his throne, his mind troubled by reports from the southern provinces.

level01_opening.speaker: Adil Shah
level01_opening.text: This Shivaji has become a thorn in our side. His raids on our territories grow bolder each day.

level01_opening.speaker: Narrator
level01_opening.text: The Sultan's eyes fell upon his most trusted general, a man of imposing stature and fearsome reputation.

level01_opening.speaker: Adil Shah
level01_opening.text: Afzal Khan, you are my finest general. I entrust you with this crucial mission.

level01_opening.speaker: Afzal Khan
level01_opening.text: My lord, I shall bring you Shivaji's head within a month. The Maratha whelp will learn to fear the might of Bijapur!

level01_opening.speaker: Narrator
level01_opening.text: And so began the campaign that would change the course of Maratha history...

level01_temple_destruction.speaker: Narrator
level01_temple_destruction.text: As Afzal Khan's army marched through the Konkan, they left a trail of destruction in their wake.

level01_temple_destruction.speaker: Narrator
level01_temple_destruction.text: Sacred temples were desecrated, villages burned, and innocent people fled in terror.

level01_temple_destruction.speaker: Villager
level01_temple_destruction.text: The demon Afzal Khan approaches! He destroys everything holy in his path!

level01_temple_destruction.speaker: Narrator
level01_temple_destruction.text: Hidden in the shadows, Shivaji's spies observed the destruction, their hearts heavy with sorrow and anger.

level01_temple_destruction.speaker: Spy
level01_temple_destruction.text: We must report this to Shivaji Maharaj immediately. The people need protection.

level01_advisor_consultation.speaker: Narrator
level01_advisor_consultation.text: At Raigad Fort, Shivaji received the disturbing reports from his network of spies and allies.

level01_advisor_consultation.speaker: Shivaji
level01_advisor_consultation.text: Afzal Khan's cruelty knows no bounds. He seeks to terrorize our people into submission.

level01_advisor_consultation.speaker: Advisor
level01_advisor_consultation.text: Maharaj, his army is vast - nearly 40,000 strong. A direct confrontation would be suicide.

level01_advisor_consultation.speaker: Shivaji
level01_advisor_consultation.text: Sometimes, my friend, the mightiest enemy can be defeated not by matching their strength, but by using their overconfidence against them.

level01_advisor_consultation.speaker: Advisor
level01_advisor_consultation.text: Your wisdom guides us, Raje. What strategy do you propose?

level01_advisor_consultation.speaker: Shivaji
level01_advisor_consultation.text: First, we must understand our enemy completely. Send our best spies to infiltrate his camp. Information will be our greatest weapon.

level01_intelligence_gathering.speaker: Narrator
level01_intelligence_gathering.text: Word came from the merchants and barbers who had been serving in Afzal Khan's camp.

level01_intelligence_gathering.speaker: Spy Merchant
level01_intelligence_gathering.text: Maharaj, Afzal Khan is arrogant beyond measure. He boasts that he will hang your head from the gates of Bijapur.

level01_intelligence_gathering.speaker: Spy Barber
level01_intelligence_gathering.text: The giant is strong, but his pride is his weakness. He underestimates you completely.

level01_intelligence_gathering.speaker: Shivaji
level01_intelligence_gathering.text: Pride goeth before a fall, they say. His arrogance will be the key to our victory.

level01_intelligence_gathering.speaker: Narrator
level01_intelligence_gathering.text: With each piece of intelligence, Shivaji began to formulate a plan that would use Afzal Khan's own confidence against him.

level01_netaji_consultation.speaker: Netaji Palkar
level01_netaji_consultation.text: Jai Bhavani, Shivaji Raje! I have been waiting for your orders.

level01_netaji_consultation.speaker: Shivaji
level01_netaji_consultation.text: Netaji, Afzal Khan approaches with a vast army. What is your assessment?

level01_netaji_consultation.speaker: Netaji Palkar
level01_netaji_consultation.text: The enemy's strength lies in numbers, but his weakness lies in arrogance. We must use the terrain to our advantage.

level01_netaji_consultation.speaker: Shivaji
level01_netaji_consultation.text: Indeed. Prepare our forces, but do not engage until I give the word. This battle will be won with strategy, not just swords.

level01_netaji_consultation.speaker: Netaji Palkar
level01_netaji_consultation.text: As you command, Raje. The Mavlas are ready to give their lives for Swarajya!

level01_completion.speaker: Narrator
level01_completion.text: As the sun set over Raigad, Shivaji stood on the ramparts, gazing toward the enemy forces below.

level01_completion.speaker: Shivaji
level01_completion.text: Knowledge is power, and patience is strength. We now understand our enemy's mind.

level01_completion.speaker: Narrator
level01_completion.text: The first phase of the campaign was complete. Shivaji had gathered crucial intelligence about Afzal Khan's nature and capabilities.

level01_completion.speaker: Narrator
level01_completion.text: Now, the real strategy could begin...

intro_dialogue.speaker: Narrator
intro_dialogue.text: In the year 1659, the shadow of war fell across the Deccan plateau...

intro_dialogue.speaker: Narrator
intro_dialogue.text: Afzal Khan, the mighty general of the Adilshahi sultanate, had been tasked with a single mission...

intro_dialogue.speaker: Narrator
intro_dialogue.text: To capture or kill the young Maratha chief, Shivaji Bhosale.

shivaji_greeting.speaker: Shivaji
shivaji_greeting.text: Namaste. I am Shivaji, protector of the people and defender of dharma.

shivaji_greeting.speaker: Shivaji
shivaji_greeting.text: These are troubled times, but with courage and wisdom, we shall prevail.
